observations: The input grids contain full-span horizontal or vertical lines of specific colors and isolated dots of various colors.
Lines can be identified by colors that fill an entire row or column.
In Example 1, horizontal lines are at rows 3 (color 2) and 10 (color 1).
In Example 2, vertical lines are at columns 3 (color 3) and 12 (color 4).
In Example 3, a horizontal line is at row 5 (color 8).
Dots that match the color of a line are moved to be adjacent to that line on the same side they originated from.
Dots that do not match the color of any line are removed.
The lines themselves remain in their original positions.
hypotheses: For each dot, if its color matches the color of a horizontal line (at row L), it moves to row L-1 (if originally above) or row L+1 (if originally below). If it matches a vertical line (at column L), it moves to column L-1 (if originally left) or column L+1 (if originally right). Non-matching dots are deleted.
Dots are attracted to the nearest boundary line of the same color, occupying the adjacent cell while maintaining their relative position (column for horizontal lines, row for vertical lines).

rejected_hypotheses.hypothesis: Dots are reflected across the line of the same color.
rejected_hypotheses.reason: In Example 1, dot (0,3) moved to (2,3) with line at row 3. Reflection would have put it at row 6.

selected_rule: Identify all full-span horizontal or vertical lines. For every single-pixel dot in the grid, if its color matches one of the line colors, move it to the cell adjacent to that line on the same side as its original position. All other dots (colors with no corresponding lines) are deleted.
step_plan: Identify the lines in Test 1: Column 4 is color 2, Column 11 is color 3, and Column 20 is color 4.
Scan the input grid for isolated dots and their colors.

Process dots matching line colors: (2, 16) color 2 moves to (2, 5); (7, 6) color 4 moves to (7, 19); (9, 13) color 3 moves to (9, 12); (10, 1) color 2 moves to (10, 3); (15, 8) color 3 moves to (15, 10); (15, 24) color 4 moves to (15, 21); (17, 22) color 3 moves to (17, 12).
Delete all dots whose colors do not match any line (color 8 dots).
Construct the output grid by placing the original lines and the newly positioned dots on a zero-filled grid of the same dimensions (19x26).
